page.title: 01THE LOWER WYE VALLEY AREA
page.content: The area is one of outstanding natu- ral beauty, the extensive woodlands dominate the landscape and are a plea- sure to see at any time of the year. The river Wye meanders its way through the valley between England and Wales. The area is protected by the county councils of Gloucestershire and Gwent, supported by the Wye Valley Preservat- ion Society. The woodlands growing on either side of the river slopes are a mixture of broadleaf and conifer trees The Forestry Commision manages the majority of the woodland and its pol- icy is to keep it open and attractive to nature lovers. Care is taken when felling and re-planting so that the character of the woodlands is not altered.An area warden service has been established and the Wye Walley walks have proved very popular.
